_sText:
The map represents a bridge on which a clash between terrorists and counter-terrorists takes place.
Both sides are heavily armored, have 1000hp, are armed with machine guns, deagle guns and offensive and smoke grenades. At the same time, the speed of players is slightly reduced.
Player models have been replaced with heavily armored special forces/terrorists (built into the map).
The goal of the terrorists is to blow up the bridge, and the special forces are to prevent this from happening.
Players can face the enemy on the bridge, hiding behind cover in the form of abandoned cars, buses, armored vehicles and downed helicopters. Or they can go under it, using the service passages, under the bridge.
In addition, each team has tactical tools (the main feature of the map):

Air-to-ground system drone, for the CT team:
The drone flies high in the sky, around the bridge along a given route. It can be used both to determine enemy positions and to destroy them.
The player has the ability to control the camera from the perspective of a drone and fire missiles at opponents.
Heavy machine gun for the CT team:
The machine gun is mounted in the window of the bus, located opposite the bomb site.
The machine gun can be controlled. It does a lot more damage, but has a limited field of view and is slow to turn.
Tactical shield for the CT team:
The shield has a chance to block bullets, or simply reduce the damage from them.
Grenade launcher for team T:
The rocket can track mouse movements and change direction accordingly. The rocket explodes when you press the RMB, or after ~2 seconds on its own.
There is a limit of 20 shots.
Unmanned drone for T:
The ability to remotely control a drone on its behalf. When approaching close to the CT, the drone explodes.
Can be destroyed with shots.
In addition to all this, each team has an AWP sniper rifle hidden at the top, with one clip.
